fields.description: In Jira 5 and lower, having the Status field be one of the axes on a two dimensional filter allowed for you to click that status, which would bring you to an issue search on the filter that was filtered to just that status.  With the new lozenges, this feature seems to have been removed entirely?  Seems like all other filtering still works on the other axis (i.e. Priority, Assignee etc), but not Status.

h5. Expected Behaviour

When bulk moving issues within the same project, the "Affects Version" (required) field will let you set a value to it, allowing the operation to effectively complete.

h5. Actual Behaviour

When bulk moving issues within the same project, the "Affects Version" (required) field will be checked in as Retained and the user will not be able to set anything for the field - not allowing the Bulk to complete.

When moving the issue directly (not using the bulk) the page let's you set the required field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to rename a JIRA Workflow step to upper or lowercase, JIRA will not allow it to be changed, and it will state that, "A step with that name already exists.".

h3. Steps to reproduce

# In a workflow, access the 'Text' mode and check the Steps 
# Click on the 'Edit' button, and in the resulting page, try to rename the step name to it's upper or lowercase equivalent. For example, change 'Open' to 'open'
# It will return the error "A step with that name already exists.", and not allow it to be changed. There are no other steps called 'open' in the workflow

h3. Workaround

This can be bypassed by first renaming the step name to something else entirely first, before changing it again to the lower or uppercase. For example, 'Open' can be changed to 'Open2', and then finally changed to 'open'.
fields.summary: Renaming JIRA Workflow step to upper or lowercase will result in an error

In a url like this:
https://<my.jira.url>/browse/<projectkey>/fixforversion/<versionid>/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:version-summary-panel


I believe this is part of the version-summary-panel module, part of the JIRA Projects Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin). 

I would like to be able to configure this view so we can raise or lower the number of issues which appear without needing to drill in further.  People are reaching this page via team calendars (after drilling into a version, which is bound to a date on the calendar) and don't find the data presented on the landing page particularly useful because it is limited to showing only the 3 most recent entries.

It would be ideal if the project admin could configure how many issues are shown on these pages up to a maximum defined by the JIRA system admin

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create 2 separate incoming mail servers (ServA & ServB)
# Create a mail handler connected to ServB (We'll call this handler TAB2)
# Open the mail handler page in two different browser tabs
# Use the first tab to create a new mail handler, enter a name (lets call it "TAB1") and select a mail server (ServA). Click *Next*.
# Now go to your second tab, and edit TAB2 by clicking *Edit* and click *Next*
#* At this point, you have both browsers having the same popup dialog, the difference being browser1 is to create a mail handler while browser2 is editing a mail handler
# Now edit something in TAB1 and save it (I configured a default reporter)
# Cancel editing process in TAB2.

h4. Expected result:
# New mail handler TAB1
# Unchanged TAB2 mail handler

h4. Actual Result:
# No new mail handler TAB1
# Changed TAB2 mail handler (default reporter is configured)

h4. Notes
# Tested using Firefox 32
fields.summary: Unable to edit different mail handlers at the same time by using multiple browser tabs

Working with epics in agile boards' PLAN mode allows to quickly recognize any tickets corresponding to a certain epic. Vice versa on the left hand side an epic can be selected to focus on only those stories which belong to exactly that epic.

This is all fine.

But if there are more epics in the list than can be displayed on the screen it will become cubersome to select an epic because one needs to scroll down and find it.

Feature wish: It would be great if I could select the epic by simply clicking on it's little sticker in the ticket's row. The GUI could display the selected epic at a prominent place on the screen and by clicking a little "x" next to it the epic would be unselected.

(This idea could also be extended to work for versions or assignees as well.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40675].
  {panel}

With the new [CSV Importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] feature, non-admins can now create issues via CSV importing. However, users are only able to map fields defined in the *Create Issue* screen. Some circumstances require users to map to fields not present in the *Create Issue* screen. These are example situations
* Let's say that I have multiple PRs to be treated and whose correction is given to a subcontractor for development.
Subcontractor does not have access to JIRA but I need to gather informations that were changed by the development team. Changes can be field modifications not present on "Create Issue" screen or status changes
When starting development, project leader gives a csv export to the subcontractor, which in return gives a modified csv file that needs to be imported into JIRA by project leader.

* Let's say that we have a validation team, which cannot access to JIRA because they are working on the field or outside our premises. They may need to add comments, modify fields not present on "Create Issue" screen and even change status in a csv file that the project leader could import into JIRA

Under these circumstances, it would be useful if the CSV Importer have the ability to map to fields which are not defined in the *Create Issue* screen
fields.summary: Ability to map to more fields when creating issues using the CSV importer

Hi guys.

It would be really nice if a JIRA incoming mail handler could be disabled, rather than having to be deleted to stop it processing.

Scenarios where this would be extremely useful. ie.  disabled until the issue resolved.
* User managed mailbox which contains items that cannot be processed, therefore generating ongoing errors.

* User managed mailbox which has an authentication issue. 

* Any maintenance of a mailbox or changes to the folder structure etc.

Thanks
Mark.
fields.summary: The ability to disable mail handlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40669].
  {panel}

*Use Case* 
A search/report has multiple criteria in the report/filter (_Project_, _fixVersion_, and _Assignee_ for example). This feature would allow _Project_ and _fixVersion_ to remain protected by the filter creator, while _Assignee_ would be modified by the user before running the search.

This would allow administrators to create a single search filter that would apply in multiple cases without needing their users to understand JQL, and preventing their filters from being modified without their knowing/consent.

This could also be accomplished by generating a prompt in the interface when the user clicks on the search filter/report to input the modifiable criteria.
fields.summary: Issue Filters with Protected Criteria

Hi there,
I'm a fairly new admin with pretty much the full set of atlassian products: jira, bamboo, confluence and fisheye.
The problem is I am yet to be successful at integrating them all together, going hurdle after hurdle.

A good first step would be to streamline the Application Link creation between those products without having to guess all the inputs.
I understand when creating those links to other application they could be necessary, but when creating the application links between the atlassian products, why do you need us to guess the values for IP patterns, URL patterns, authentications incoming and outgoing? Those are all your products, you cannot fill all of that for us instead of making us guess and go through your confluence pages (like this broken one for example from the latest version of JIRA https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE035/Configuring+Trusted+Applications+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link) to find list of URL patterns that are not even consistent.
Why does it take more than 1 click to link 2 atlassian products?

So, please, can you auto-fill all the answers for application links when linking atlassian products with each other? (or even don't even show them)

thanks
fields.summary: Can you make JIRA looking like well integrated with Confluence, Bamboo and Fisheye

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40647].
  {panel}

This is related to JRA-33941 and may be JRA-29032

As plugin vendor I've got several customer complains that gadget is not rendered properly on Internet Explorer 9 (IE9). See [Issue#559|https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/559/timesheet-gadget-displays-data-incorrectly] for example.

It's clearly reproducible, but I'm trying hard to find anything I can do in plugin with no luck.

I hope there is something that can be done in JIRA gadget container.

E.g. /plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr servlet can provide X-UA compatibility meta in html head.

It may be that JRA-29032 has caused such regression, by removing chrome=1 from X-UA Compatibility meta.

Note, JIRA standard gadgets are not using iframes any more, so there is no such problem there, but plugin gadgets are in iframe, so I suspect they may need own X-UA compatibility meta, that can not be provided by gadget itself, but may be provided by JIRA instead.

Is it something that Atlassian can look at, please?

Thank you.
fields.summary: X-UA Compatibility Meta Tag in JIRA 6 plugin gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40638].
  {panel}

When stopping JIRA using the stop-jira.sh script it calls shutdown.sh -force, which passes the -force on to catalina.sh.

We should not be passing the -force option as it does a {{kill -9}} on the process after a set timeout. 

By default we should send a {{kill -TERM}} on the process. ie. a regular {{kill <pid>}} to allow the application to do some cleanup before exiting.

h4. Workaround
Use the shutdown.sh script instead as it does not pass the -force option to catalina.sh
fields.summary: stop-jira script should not pass -force option

fields.description:
When character limit is set (advanced options) the character limit for a comment is decreased by one which each newline.
The same does not apply to issue description/environment (correct limit is used).

Reproduction steps:
1. Set character limit in JIRA to some value (for example 10).
2. Create a project and an issue
3. Open the issue and enter a comment on the issue of maximum allowed length minus one (in this example 9) and a newline. This amounts to 10 characters in total which does not exceed the limit.

Expected:
Comment is created

Actual:
There's an error and comment is not created.
!Screen Shot 2014-10-30 at 14.50.41.png!

Additional info:
When creating a comment using "edit" issue or with a middle click on "Comment" button (opens up a form in a separate tab) it displays error message about text exceeding the character limit.
fields.summary: Error when comment contains N-1 characters and a newline and character limit is set to N

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40630].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
h5. Scenario 1
* Shared a filter to user "danny"
!filter_1.jpg|thumbnail!
* Accessed the filter via the email received (user "danny" not logged on) and you will be redirected to an error page
!filter_5.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_2.jpg|thumbnail!

h5. Scenario 2
* Login and copy the URL of the filter from the browser. Log out and paste it on a browser. You will be redirected to a login page.
!filter_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_4.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_6.jpg|thumbnail!

Both scenario show that the user is not logged on, yet being redirected to different pages. It would be great if this can be fixed by redirecting users to the same page regardless of the manner of accessing the filter (whether via email or copy/paste from the browser URL).
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior when accessing a filter (user not logged on)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40629].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Default post functions order causing comment added in transition screen to be denied with certain status' property: 
* *jira.permission.comment.user* set to denied/false. - This is fixed on JRA-44123
*  *jira.permission.work.denied* set to denied/false

*Cause*
When JIRA performing the post functions, the issue's status will get changed first before comment is added. This is causing the property to get enforced thus denying changes in the fields even it is added during transition.

*Steps to Replicate*

# Add a workflow property at the destination step: {{jira.permission.work.denied}} value {{denied}}
# Add a screen to the transition to the destination step above, which have the field included
# Publish the workflow
# Try running transition with a value in the restricted field from destination step.

*Expected Behavior*
Input during transition should be added still and only restrict after status has been change in JIRA view.

*Actual Behavior*
The workflow property is in place and causing the transition with the value to be ignored
fields.summary: Default post functions order causing values added in transition to be denied with certain status' property

fields.description:
After following this description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+To+Disable+SSLv3+to+Mitigate+Against+POODLE+Exploit+for+JIRA?focusedCommentId=683541348&#comment-683541348

Jira doesnt work anymore.

Our default server.xml contains following:
scheme="https" secure="true" sslProtocol="TLS"
If i include:
scheme="https" secure="true" sslProtocol="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2"

our server doesn't work after restart. After change to the default settings jira starts again.

We don't have any proxy infront of JIRA - just for internal use.
fields.summary: After disable SSL 3.0 (cause of Poodle) Jira doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40617].
  {panel}

*Behavior*
After migrating from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA v6.3.8, trying to view/edit certain workflows in _Diagram_ mode leads to a server error in the GUI.
!208199.png|thumbnail!

The following stack is found in {{catalina.out}}:
{noformat}
/rest/workflowDesigner/latest/workflows [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: No initial status
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No initial status
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.getInitialStepId(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:347)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.addedTransitions(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.update(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl.updateLayoutWithDataFromWorkflow(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:48)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.updateLayoutWithDataFromWorkflow(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:164)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.updateExistingLayout(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:142)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.getExistingLayoutOrCreate(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.WorkflowLayoutsImpl.getLayout(WorkflowLayoutsImpl.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.rest.WorkflowsResource.getWorkflow(WorkflowsResource.java:69)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.expand.interceptor.ExpandInterceptor.intercept(ExpandInterceptor.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.invokeMethodWithInterceptors(DispatchProviderHelper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker._dispatch(DispatchProviderHelper.java:230)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.method.dispatch.ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.dispatch(ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.java:75)
{noformat}

This issue was reproduced locally using a customer XML backup.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Migrate from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA v6.3.8 Server
# Try to view/edit workflows as _Diagram_

*Workaround*
# Export problematic workflow as XML
# Import the same XML back into JIRA
# Navigate to {{Administration >> Issues >> Workflow Schemes}} to re-assign issue types to imported workflow

When utilizing this workaround, the only changes that are occurring to the workflow itself are the author and creation date - this can be verified by comparing XML exports of the same workflow pre- and post-import - but the imported workflow is available to view/edit as a diagram at {{Administration >> Issues >> Workflows}}.
fields.summary: Migrating from OnDemand to JIRA 6.3.8 Server Breaks Workflow Diagrams

fields.description:
----
Steps to reproduce:
1- Create a user with '+' in its username
2- List the users
3- Hover on the newly created user
4- Click on "More" and "Administer User"
----

JIRA can't handle the '+' characters in usernames
but actually creates such usernames automatically when coming from Atlassian ID.

See example below:
!http://snag.gy/9qVRo.jpg!

leads to
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/82435/CqMTZSTYf6KMpFY/upload.png!
fields.summary: JIRA can't handle '+' in usernames
Cloning issue: Clone subtask should have option to be UNTICKED by DEFAULT
Jira should not try to load disabled validator class.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40602].
  {panel}

Hi,

Could we add a disclaimer to the image render section of [Text Formatting Notation Help|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] stating that currently you are unable to use this if the image name is identical to the issue name.

This will avoid customers trying this and then creating support issues for this.

Related issues:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32688
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37893
fields.summary: Unable to render embedded object if file name is equal to issue name.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Establish a New JIRA Instance.
# Create a New Issue.
# Download and extract {{.tar}} from this ticket.
# Attach the extracted ZIP File to the issue.

*Expected Result:*
As any other file, it will shows in the Attachment Panel.

*Actual Result:*
A red banner error is being thrown in the panel.
!arkattach.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) This Screenshot actually taken from SAC.

*Notes*:
* The file seems to be compressed by KDE Dolphin manager
* This is another command to compressed the file {{ark --changetofirstpath --add --autofilename zip <filename>}}
* In the database, the ZIP column holds NULL value.
!arkdata.PNG|thumbnail!

*Workaround*:
* Clicking on the Drop Down button and select "Manage Attachment" could show the file including download it.
* Modifying the ZIP column value from NULL to 0.
fields.summary: Attachment Panel throws Error when Attaching a ZIP file compressed using ARK

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40596].
  {panel}

We need to specify a few things about each JIRA events, for example:
1- Is this notification raised before or after the operation?
2- Has the issue been re-indexed?
3- Is the event raised within a transaction?
4- Is transaction committed?
5- ...
fields.summary: Update developer documentation about events

fields.description:
Copying {{seraph-config.xml}} from v6.2.x> to v6.3.x installation files during upgrade causes the upgrade to fail with the following error occurring in catalina.out:
{noformat}
Could not getRequest service: com.atlassian.jira.user.preferences.UserPreferencesResetInterceptor : java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.user.preferences.UserPreferencesResetInterceptor
{noformat}

*Resolution*
# Stop JIRA
# Comment out the following code block in {{seraph-config.xml}}:
{code}
<interceptors>
<interceptor class="com.atlassian.jira.user.preferences.UserPreferencesResetInterceptor"/>
</interceptors>
{code}
# Start JIRA

Knowledge base article: [Upgrade to JIRA v6.3 Fails Due to Deprecated Interceptor Class| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Upgrade+to+JIRA+v6.3+Fails+Due+to+Deprecated+Interceptor+Class]
fields.summary: Deprecated seraph-config class breaks upgrade to v6.3.x from v6.2 or lower

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Outgoing Email
# Navigate to an issue and choose the Share option
# In the Note section, add the following:
{code}
Line One
Line Two

Line Three
{code}
(i) Notice the line break
# Share the issue

h4. Expected behavior
Email notification will render the message with line break

h4. Actual result
Email notification render the message in a single line
{code}
Line One Line Two Line Three
{code}

h4. Note
Default outgoing email format doesn't affect the behavior of the email notification
fields.summary: Line break doesn't work for email notification via Share Issue

fields.description:
I have discovered this as follows (thanks [~pbugalski] for help): 
1. *Setup JAVA_HOME to point to java 6 32b* -this is essential as lucene with java 64b uses MMapDirectory which does not look to leak those files (but I'm not sure)
2. *  setup byteman with local JIRA *

{noformat}
/jmake run --override-dev-mode --setup-home -J"-Datlassian.org.osgi.framework.bootdelegation=weblogic,weblogic.*,META-INF.services,com.yourkit,com.yourkit.*,com.chronon,com.chronon.*,com.jprofiler,com.jprofiler.*,org.apache.xerces,org.apache.xerces.*,org.apache.xalan,org.apache.xalan.*,org.apache.xml.serializer,sun.*,com.sun.xml.bind.v2,com.icl.saxon,org.jboss.byteman,org.jboss.byteman.*  -javaagent:/home/adam/programs/byteman2.2.0.1/lib/byteman.jar=boot:/home/adam/programs/byteman2.2.0.1/lib/byteman.jar,listener:true,port:9096" quickstart  > output.log
{noformat}

*Fix* you byteman path above if you want to run the same command
3. *Injected byteman rule with ./bmsubmit from byteman bin*

{noformat}
RULE trace file descriptors
CLASS java.io.FileDescriptor
METHOD incrementAndGetUseCount
AT EXIT
IF callerMatches(".+NIOFSIndexInput.+",true,true,1,100)
AND $0.fd >0
DO traceStack("Open "+$0.fd  + " " +Thread.currentThread().getName()+" ")
ENDRULE
RULE trace file descriptor close
CLASS java.io.FileDescriptor
METHOD decrementAndGetUseCount
AT EXIT
IF callerMatches(".+NIOFSIndexInput.+",true,true,1,100)
AND $0.fd >0 
DO traceStack("Close "+$0.fd+" count " +$0.useCount.get() + " " +Thread.currentThread().getName()+" ")
ENDRULE
{noformat}
This rule logs stacktrace of opening and closing files 
4.  Stress JIRA I have used the following bash:

{noformat}
 for i in {1..2000}; do (curl 'http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa?decorator=none' -H 'Cookie: jira.issue.navigator.type=ADVANCED; JSESSIONID=A6F3FD8377BE0DB5F07014585020F837; JSESSIONID=444A3FC1D5C2A9782CFF6268BF73DAE9; atlassian.xsrf.token=BD48-SHL1-G381-30YD|bf57e0daa174da95d61a667834e427a295eac373|lin; upm.atl.id=admin%7Ca286a8679ffc094b3b75dfc7faa4b4b3dda80d3c863fcf508ef81c6dd3bd94e6; AJS.conglomerate.cookie="|workflow-mode=diagram"; __utma=1.1866491299.1358182023.1411550702.1411561633.127; __utmc=1; __utmz=1.1366101499.12.2.utmcsr=adamj:2990|utmccn=(referral)|utmcmd=referral|utmcct=/jira/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/user-installed; studio.crowd.tokenkey=J0uauzNgUCkyS31oddMyQg00' -H 'Origin: http://localhost:8090' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate,sdch' -H 'Accept-Language: en-AU,en;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.6,pl;q=0.4' -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/36.0.1985.143 Safari/537.36' -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8' -H 'Accept: */*' -H 'Referer: http://localhost:8090/jira/browse/DEMO-5143' -H 'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'X-AUSERNAME: admin' --data 'pid=10000&issuetype=3&atl_token=BD48-SHL1-G381-30YD%7Cbf57e0daa174da95d61a667834e427a295eac373%7Clin&formToken=9cfa60cdbdc04db954c005a9fe1ef3840339c3f5&summary=test2&priority=3&description=&dnd-dropzone=&fieldsToRetain=project&fieldsToRetain=issuetype&fieldsToRetain=priority' --compressed ) & done;
{noformat}
To obtain the curl use above:  open create dialog in your JIRA on chrome open development tools and switch to network. Then create some issue -> right click on the network connection that created issue and select "copy as cURL"
5. while running above query I was using JIRA normally changing issues, commenting, searching.

The results I got is that all the files that appeared in lsof as deleted had the pattern that they were opened once and closed twice each time except the last time when the file is opened and not closed. 
All stacktraces from leaked files looked like this

fields.summary: JIRA together with the issue search plugin is leaking lucene file descriptors
Project Pivot Report sets end date to a day prior to the selected date in the configuration screen

fields.description:
If you enter HTML into the project description it does not get rendered. Reproduced this on a clean 6.3.8 instance.

Looks like this has happened in the past:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20032
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15906

Regression? Or possibly a different root cause?
fields.summary: HTML does not render in Project Description
Reuse Transition from edit workflow in text mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40578].
  {panel}

h3. Step To Reproduce
Create an issue, and upload attachment
Hover over the relative time for the attachment

h3. Expected Results
An exact timestamp is shown after hovering the relative time

h3. Actual Results
No exact timestamp is shown.

This feature works on other relative timestamps such as Dates but doesn't work for attachments.

h3. Work Around
Turn off Relative Time and display exact time for all date fields
- shut down JIRA
- edit <JIRA_HOME>/JIRA/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jpm.xml
- find the setting for jira.lf.date.relativize
- set this to false
- start JIRA back up
fields.summary: Relative Time on Attachment Doesn't Display Exact Time on Hover
Use diferent e-mail setting for a user on LDAP directory.
User signup form and moderation

fields.description:
The current timezone in Moscow is GMT +3 hours, but JIRA still shows it as +4 [^Moscow.jpg]. This is causing time displays to be off for users with their default timezones set to Moscow +4. 

Additionally, updating the JVM's timezone data using the tzupdater tool doesn't seem to help. It fixes the display issue where Moscow will now show +3, but all the dates and times displayed in JIRA are still ahead by 1 hour. 

*Workaround* 
*==========*
# Change the timezone settings (profile or General Configuration) to use *GMT OFFSET +03:00* OR
# Update joda-time in {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib}} to last version (2.5). Download the library from [here|https://github.com/JodaOrg/joda-time/releases]. Next, update JAVA's timezone data using the tzupdater tool: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tzupdater-readme-136440.html
fields.summary: JIRA showing Russia/Moscow timezone as +4 instead of +3
Created vs Resolved Chart should show real cumulative values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40571].
  {panel}

As mentioned in JRA-39411
* Anonymous users are able to create issues 
* Deactivated users are not treated as anonymous. They won't be able to create issues

However, there are no warning messages that deactivated users cannot create tickets. It would be better if there is a warning message so the administrators or the user itself is aware of it. Otherwise, the emails will just be ignored and neither the admin nor the user will be aware that potentially important emails are being ignored.

While JRA-39411 is about treating deactivated users as anonymous, this is about a warning message that deactivated users cannot create tickets via email.
fields.summary: Warning message that deactivated Users cannot create Tickets via email

fields.description:
Hi,

Recently I've tried reading HOCON config file from a blueprint hook and got nothing. This library com.typesafe:config uses Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader() to search for configuration.

Examination of this issue shown that the context classloader is set to WebappClassLoader in case when hook is applied while blueprint project is being created. If (for testing purposes) the hook is made a component module, then its context class loader is set to BundleDelegatingClassLoader which works as expected.

It's possible that other libraries that use context classloader would behave differently in different plugin modules and cause difficult to debug issues.
fields.summary: AddProjectHook: WebappClassLoader as Context Class Loader
